antichess
Class ChessBoard

java.lang.Object
  antichess.Board<ChessMove>
      antichess.ChessBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AntichessBoard
public class ChessBoard
extends Board<ChessMove>
implements Cloneable

A ChessBoard represents the state of a Chess Game at some time. The ChessBoard keeps track of the location of all of the pieces both on the board and that have been captured, as well as a list of optionally timestamped moves that have been made thus far in the game.

ChessBoards are mutable and cloneable.

ChessBoards also include some static variables that describe various end-game conditions, including ChessBoard.CHECKMATE (value = 1) and ChessBoard.STALEMATE (value = 2). Checks of the end-game information should compare the stored GameOverReason() against these values.

Specification Fields :
capturedPieces : Set // The Pieces in the captured pile
